name: StoneCutterInventory
description: The StoneCutterInventory class provides specialized access to Minecraft's stonecutter interface, allowing scripts to interact with stonecutter operations such as selecting crafting recipes and managing stone-based crafting recipes.
overview:
This class extends the base Inventory class and adds stonecutter-specific functionality for managing available recipes, selecting specific recipes, and accessing recipe outputs.

Stonecutters in Minecraft have two main slots:
- Input (Slot 0): The stone-type block to be crafted (e.g., stone, cobblestone, etc.)
- Output (Slot 1): The resulting stone block variant based on the selected recipe

The stonecutter interface allows players to craft various stone variants from a single stone input block, making it highly efficient for building projects.

You typically get StoneCutterInventory instances when the player has a stonecutter screen open via `Inventory.create()`.

methods.name: getSelectedRecipeIndex
methods.description: Retrieves the index of the currently selected recipe in the stonecutter interface.

methods.name: selectRecipe
methods.description: Selects a specific recipe in the stonecutter based on the provided index.

parameters.name: index
parameters.description: The index of the recipe to select.

methods.name: getAvailableRecipeCount
methods.description: Returns the total number of recipes available for the item currently placed in the input slot.

methods.name: getRecipes
methods.description: Retrieves a list of items representing the output of all available recipes for the current input.

methods.name: getOutput
methods.description: Retrieves the item currently displayed in the output slot (Slot 1) based on the selected recipe.

methods.name: canCraft
methods.description: Checks if the current setup allows for crafting (e.g., valid input and valid recipe selection).
